column4: ok..I am having problems wityh ubuntu 8.04
I cannot seem to get a gui running under the server version
I( cant seem to install tomcat under the desktop version
sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start
...is doesnt seem to want to do that , after I installed gdm
did you install xfce (xubuntu) or Ubuntu (gnome) or Kubuntu (kde)?
..are you telling me that gdm is already installed under the server version ?
..I installed the server version, and it will have been the gneom version is there was a choice
nope.. it's not.. you have to install it yourself with sudo apt-get install xubuntu-desktop or ubuntu-desktop
server comes only with a command line
..are you telling me taht AFTER I install the server version, then I should install the desktop verion using apt-get ?
yes
..is there likley to be any problem with twin dual core opterons ?
with 32bit server.. probably not
..are you telling me that the 64 bit server is liley to have a problem ?
no.. It's just that if you have no 64 bit experience don't use it.. most programs are compiled for the 32bit environment and not all will work in 64 bit without some tweeking.
if you're use to that then go for it..
no.. you never mentioned mythbuintu
if you want server install server then ubuntu-desktop
